proverb: However long the night, the dawn will always break.
source: NosweatShakespeare – 200 Inspirational African Proverbs

proverb: When two elephants fight, it is the grass that gets hurt.
source: NosweatShakespeare – 200 Inspirational African Proverbs

proverb: The axe forgets but the tree remembers.
source: NosweatShakespeare – 200 Inspirational African Proverbs

proverb: All monkeys cannot hang from the same branch.
source: NosweatShakespeare – 200 Inspirational African Proverbs

proverb: A bird that flies off the Earth and lands on an anthill is still on the ground.
source: African Proverbs PDF – Boost Africa

proverb: Only a fool tests the depth of a river with both feet.
source: African Proverbs PDF – Boost Africa

proverb: Knowledge is a garden. If it isn’t cultivated, you can’t harvest it.
source: African Proverbs PDF – Boost Africa

proverb: Examine what is said, not who is speaking.
source: African Proverbs PDF – Boost Africa

proverb: Pretend you are dead and you will see who really loves you.
source: NosweatShakespeare – 200 Inspirational African Proverbs

proverb: A man who uses force is afraid of reasoning.
source: Goodreads – African Proverbs collection

proverb: Where there is love, there is no darkness.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: There are three friends in life: courage, sense, and insight.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Beauty is half a God-given favor; intelligence a whole one.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Don’t be afraid to look at your faults.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: If you do not know where you are going, any road will take you there.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Dine with a stranger but save your love for your family.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: The big game often appears when the hunter has given up.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: No matter how hot your anger, it cannot cook yams.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Wisdom is like hair; everyone has their own.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: The family is like a forest: dense outside, ordered within.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Silence is also a speech.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: A grown tree cannot be bent into a walking stick.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: If you plant turnips, you will not harvest grapes.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Before healing others, heal yourself.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: The horse of greed gallops to the door of shame.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: A bitter heart consumes its owner.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: When elephants fight, it’s the grass that suffers.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Only a fool tests the river with both feet.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: By trying often, the monkey learns to jump.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: The elephant never tires of its tusks.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Stand with your mother’s blessing and all odds fall away.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Mistakes belong to those who work.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Where you sit in old age shows where you stood in youth.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: The hunter chasing the elephant ignores the birds.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: You must be willing to die to live.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Before shooting, one must aim.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: The one who asks questions never loses the way.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: By going and coming, a bird weaves its nest.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Strategy is stronger than strength.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: You know who you love; not who loves you.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Every door has its own key.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Loving one who does not love you is shaking a tree for dew.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Though snakes don’t fly, they catch birds.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Keep your eyes on your goal, not on where you stumbled.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: People are a person’s medicine.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: A tree does not move unless there is wind.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Treat the world well—it’s lent by your children.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Standing tall means standing on the backs of ancestors.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: A master knows about studenthood.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: The roaring lion kills no prey.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: A good discussion is like great treasure.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: No matter your kindness, goats still eat your yam.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Lack of knowledge is darker than night.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: With your hands, you make or destroy success.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: No medicine can cure hatred.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Don’t fight a lion with a stick.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: To seek advice, present all facts.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Do a thing at its right time for peace.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: A lie can destroy a thousand truths.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Even a perfect fig may hide a worm.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Rain cannot wash the leopard’s spots.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Learning expands great souls.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: You do not teach the path to the old gorilla.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Wisdom is like a baobab tree; no one embraces it alone.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: However much it rains, bananas won’t grow on your head.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Confiding in the unworthy is like a leaking bag.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: No climb avoids crushing weeds.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: A brave man dies once; a coward a thousand times.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: One arrow can fell an elephant.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Crying doesn’t bring peace of mind.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Not everyone who chased the zebra caught it—but all who caught it, chased it.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Endurance leads to a smile after pain.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: A habit conquers the mind.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: No wise man leaves a stream to drink from a pool.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Don’t insult the forest that shelters you.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: A person’s origins are seen in their character.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Obstinacy helps no one.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: All heads are the same; all thoughts are not.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Happiness needs something to do, love, and hope.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: On a road to nowhere, find another.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Disrespectful youth cannot eat with elders.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: If your mouth is a knife, it will cut your lips.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Little by little, the bird builds its nest.
source: Kentake Page – 100 Afrikan Proverbs to be Guided By

proverb: Do not follow the path; create a new trail.
